description: Coined by American physicist Frank Wilczek in 1978 after Axion, a brand of laundry detergent, for its -on suffix and the notion that the new particle could "clean up" a problem in physics.

entries.meaning: (physics) A hypothetical subatomic particle postulated to resolve certain symmetry problems concerning the strong nuclear force.
examples: The axion is a candidate particle for the cold dark matter that constitutes a large fraction of the mass of the Universe.
